techmeme.title: In an interview, Mark Zuckerberg says there will not be "just one AI", disparages closed-source AI competitors as trying to "create God", and more (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
OpenAI details CriticGPT, a model based on GPT-4 to catch errors in ChatGPT's code output, assisting human trainers in assessing and spotting errors (Will Knight/Wired)
Amazon folds its Amazon Clinic telehealth service into One Medical, with more affordable per-visit pricing: $49 for a video call or $29 to text a doctor (Lauren Forristal/TechCrunch)
MegaLabs, the developer behind the Ethereum scaling protocol MegaETH that it claims is a "real-time blockchain", raised $20M in seed funding led by Dragonfly (Margaux Nijkerk/CoinDesk)
Meta starts testing user-created AI chatbots on Instagram in the US; Mark Zuckerberg says the chatbots, made using Meta AI studio, will be clearly labeled as AI (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
